ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: It's a tough class, namely because of the homework problems in Jackson. The exams are fairly qualitative though and are reasonable.

While I feel like I got a fair amount out of the class, I wouldn't have taken it if it wasn't a departmental requirement. It isn't really directly related to any current research in experimental physics that I will be involved with on a day-to-day basis throughout the rest of grad school or my subsequent career.
Yes. It does offer a good foundation for fundamental concepts in E&M.

This course provides a rigorous overview of electromagnetic theory as expressed by Jackson, covering most of the important topics discussed in the book. I would recommend this course, especially for its helpful presentation of the theory behind many of the commonly used equations in E&M.
Physics 508 is a very hard class. However, because it is required form the physics phd, I would advise keeping up with the material closely.
I think in terms of a grad E&M class following Jackson, this is one of the best versions of the class.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: It's not very helpful for applied physics, but everyone needs to know some sort of fundamentals of electromagnetism.
Gave me a very thou rough understanding of electrodynamics.
I think it may be useful, however I am too early in my program to know that for sure.
